location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 199 of 1851 from Lieutenant Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire to Justin Sheil, HM Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: The letter reports that the Province of Fars is in a state of tranquillity. The exception being the area around Gowbundee where Fort Malekaya has been taken by Shaikh Yoosoof bin Moobaruk, former Chief of Nabend. It notes that a force under the command of Shaikh Abdoolla ben Khulfan – brother of Futeh Ally Khan – will attempt to recover it.It further notes that Houssein Khan has been removed from the Government of Dashtee district, and replaced by his brother Hyder Khan. It also mentions that robberies appear to be on the increase in the region around Shiraz.
